body_html:
I am not aware of anyone working on this. We'd happily take a patch!

That said, for simple cases (I understand np.repeat supports more general cases) like the one you cited, you could do

with tf.Session() as sess:
  print sess.run(tf.reshape(
      tf.tile(tf.expand_dims([1, 2, 3], -1),  [1, 2]), [-1]))

which is both CPU- and GPU-compatible.
body_text:
I am not aware of anyone working on this.  We'd happily take a patch!
That said, for simple cases (I understand np.repeat supports more general cases) like the one you cited, you could do
with tf.Session() as sess:
  print sess.run(tf.reshape(
      tf.tile(tf.expand_dims([1, 2, 3], -1),  [1, 2]), [-1]))
which is both CPU- and GPU-compatible.
body:
I am not aware of anyone working on this.  We'd happily take a patch!  

That said, for simple cases (I understand `np.repeat` supports more general cases) like the one you cited, you could do 
```python
with tf.Session() as sess:
  print sess.run(tf.reshape(
      tf.tile(tf.expand_dims([1, 2, 3], -1),  [1, 2]), [-1]))
```
which is both CPU- and GPU-compatible.
